website_summaries.verdict: A straightforward option for those looking to balance performance with budget. It performs as advertised, with a comfortable price tag.
pros: Four channels offer convenience and variety for the listener
Each jack has its own volume control, so you can get the right mix every time
The sleek professional look of this amp betrays its frugal price point
cons: Distortion can be a problem with this amp at higher volumes
Quality of connected peripherals can also cause more sound distortion than with other amps

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE OR MISLEADING
customer_reviews.text: The unit is sold as accepting a TRS STEREO input and producing a set of 4 STEREO outputs. The unit I received takes the STEREO TRS input, converts it to mono on one side only and then puts the signal out on one side of the output. If I slide the input connector, I can get it rough MONO on both sides of the output, but that is not what it said it did.
customer_reviews.author: vwvan

customer_reviews.title: Behringing Ears Together
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this headamp since I purchased one that set me back $100, and while that one did what it was meant to do, I realized $100 was expensive for what it was. This one being $25 made me hesitate about what it was capable of doing... I took the risk and purchased it. This is definitely worth the $25! It did the exact same thing my other $100 did! I saved myself the extra $75 and went ahead and bought a packet of Cable Matters 3.5 mm to 1/4 in adapter (set of 5). It's not the sleekest headamp you can buy but it definitely gets the job done. Happy Amazon shopping!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel F. Aguinaga

customer_reviews.title: This device introduces a lot of noise.
customer_reviews.text: This device introduces a lot of noise when the sum of any combo of knobs hits a certain amount. About half power for each knob will make the outputs buzz and the left/right channels get out of balance too. Gets worse with a higher summed volume between the knobs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy hookup, works great right out of the box. I bought it to hook up to my TV audio out so I can watch TV while the kids are sleeping. I also bought some Male to Male 3.5mm cables like 6.35mm Male to 3.5mm Female Stereo Adapters like 3.5mm Stereo Jack Male to Female Extension Cable like  That combination gave me A LOT OF FLEXIBILITY. Now my wife and I each have our own volume control.
customer_reviews.author: ericjwin

customer_reviews.title: Great little amp
customer_reviews.text: This was a much needed addition to my minimalist home recording setup. There is no control room, just mics, audio interface, and a laptop. With this little amp, 4 people can individually dial in the volume on a pair of headphones. The unit is tiny, and as another reviewer said, the input and all 4 outputs are on the same side. This isn't a problem if you aren't constantly plugging and unplugging. Also, there is no on/off switch. I run this through a power strip, so no problem there either. The clarity and volume of every channel is great. This is a huge benefit to singers and accompanists during recording.
customer_reviews.author: dberman

customer_reviews.title: Trouble from the start
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but trouble with this from the beginning. Only one one side can be heard most of the time, unless the stars are aligned. Even then, only one headset at a time works without distortion. All cables and headsets have been tested without this unit and work 100% of the time. Don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: alexhen

customer_reviews.title: This little amp does the trick nicely. It is easily setup utilizing 1/4" jacks for ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to split a single headphone output from a computer to a couple of inputs without losing quality. This little amp does the trick nicely. It is easily setup utilizing 1/4" jacks for the headphones (note that you may need an adapter as many headphones are 3.5mm). The volume knobs adjust nicely without producing static as they are adjusted. The only issue I had with this is that one of my 1/4" adapters was only outputting on one speaker when attached to this amp - the outputs are not completely tight on a 1/4" plug which allows some wiggle room. However, i would say that overall this headphone amp is a great value and works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse NietzerTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews for this product before buying. The Behringer Microamp HA400 is complete garbage. I tried multiple sets of headphones in every headphone jack on this thing and every the audio only came through one side of the headphones and was distorted. I got a little better sounding audio when I jiggled the headphone cable which makes me thing this thing is just poorly made. DO NOT BUY! I'm returning mine immediately.
customer_reviews.author: DugTucky

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed in 3 days
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit as a replacement for an identical unit that got crushed. It worked great for 2 days and on the third day all channels were heavy with static and heavy signal loss. I am returning the unit through Amazon for an identical replacement in hopes that the quality is the same standard as the first one I bought. I'm hoping that the issues that I'm having with the current one is just a fluke. BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Jinx

customer_reviews.title: The headphone amp no one talks about.
customer_reviews.text: Using this with my stereo cans on PC, both for listening to music and gaming. Bought Beyerdynamic DT 990's in the 32 Ohm version as to avoid having to have a amp.. needed one anyway with my older onboard soundcard that just simply wasn't loud enough for me. This was a great cheap solution. Really the only cheap solution as it seems the cheapest amps on anyone's radar start at $60. This little amp is great for that specific scenario. There is no processing of the sound whatsoever, just pure power. Now I really wish I would've bought the 250 ohm 990's or 80 ohm 770's, since I needed the amp anyway.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!  Poor, Poor Quality.  Very Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these and all were defective. I can't help but wonder if the positive reviews are faked. When you plug in your headsets you can't hear out of both sides of the headsets, the sound comes and goes, any movement on the cord causes a disturbance in sound quality, and some of the headsets could not be heard at all (but work fine in other devices). I've given up on Behringer. I don't usually write back reviews, but this is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Beefy little micro amp!
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Ive read reviews complaining about only getting mono sound, not true, to that I say that you have to make sure you have the correct cord. The metal "male" end of the jack must have 2 black rings on it for stereo sound, if yours only has 1 you'll only get mono, because that's a mono jack. Feel me. Btw, I had to learn that the hard way years ago lol. Ran 4 sets of headphones off of this for a podcast. It's dope. Only downside is having to find one more outlet to pull it into, kinda wish there was a USB option. But that's just a nitpick.
customer_reviews.author: Kashta Coulter

customer_reviews.title: Nice that the volume is controlled independently by the output ...
customer_reviews.text: Using this to boost my PA's monitor-out signal (unamplified), so my music partner and I can hear ourselves in our headphones (me) and earbuds (her). Nice that the volume is controlled independently by the output line, and supports up to four outputs. We sometimes use one of those to send an amplified signal to my laptop to record. All works just fine -- a nice inexpensive solution, just what we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Morse

customer_reviews.title: IS NOT STEREO OUTPUT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for church, and it does not work as well as I wanted. I did not believe other reviews, but I can confirm that the outputs produce sound on only one side of my headphones, meaning it is mono. I discovered after jiggling with the cable connections that if i plug it in the perfect amount (not all the way in) it will be stereo. However, this is inconvenient and not as advertised. Also, the quality is not as good, and no bass comes out from it at all. Would not recommened this product, spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Wong

customer_reviews.title: Unusable - destroys the audio signal.
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's a complete waste of money. Audio signal doesn't fully make it through the input->output, so it sounds like you're listening to 1/2 the signal. I've tested the outputs directly (unamplified, obviously) and it sounds perfect... if a little quiet (which is why I bought the amp). Everything is clear, present, and balanced though. But running audio through the amp actually drops out some of the signal. Dialog, for example. Unplug the amp and listen directly and all is perfectly balanced again. Unusable at this point. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Rrrrrrrrrrawr!

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use, very quiet and durable.
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this in a small home studio where we do everything from live broadcast to acoustic / vocal recording to podcasting and it works well. Volume controls are whisper quiet and there’s no buzz, and it’s pretty rugged. Can’t really think of anything I’d change about it to be honest, it does one thing and does it very well. NB: I’m using mid-range closed-back phones with this, nothing more than $150. I don’t think you’d see much loss with a pair in the $500+ range, but if you’re there and still thinking about getting one of these then I’m sure you know what to look out for :)
customer_reviews.author: Tim Post

customer_reviews.title: Attenuates original source and adds distortion.
customer_reviews.text: Product is a complete fail. With my original DAC and amp I can power 3 headphones with a passive splitter and the amp’s gain know turned up 1/3 of the way. If I run the phones through this plugged into the amp, I have to turn the amp gain up to 2/3 of the way and then the volume of the Behringer up 1/2 to get the same volume output - with poorer sound quality. You’re better off using a passive splitter and inline pots than this POS. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: AHF

customer_reviews.title: A good little headphone amplifier
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a headphone amplifier for the line output of a video monitor to studio-quality (600 ohm) headphones. I tried several different units and most didn't have enough output to adequately drive high-impedance headphones. Someone told me that the Behringer HA400 would work, so I gave it a try. It seems to work well, and while it will never drive my headphones loud enough to hurt my ears, it is more than adequate loudness for my purpose. As far as I can tell, the amplification is linear and does not cut or boost highs or lows.
customer_reviews.author: LLL

customer_reviews.title: Great little headphone amp!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little headphone amp! I'm using it to add a headphone port for my tube integrated amplifier which only has speaker outputs. The sound is clear & undistorted and there's plenty of volume available for any headphone I choose to plug in. I was expecting a larger unit based on the Amazon description of 5" x 7" - but that's the package size. The actual unit is only 2.25" x 4" so it deserves the "ultra-compact" label. This microamp has a quality feel; everything plugs in firmly and the volume controls are silky smooth. I highly recommend this to anyone wanting to add a headphone port to their audio system.
customer_reviews.author: violinmom

customer_reviews.title: One of the outputs has weird noises mixed with the sound
customer_reviews.text: One of the outputs has weird noises mixed with the sound but I'm unable to return the unit and ask for replacement. Otherwise looks sturdy and I like the volume controls. I would have paid extra US$ 5 if the unit had on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: dekiblue

customer_reviews.title: Totally Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Behringer equipment is a lot like candy corn -- it looks amazing til you try it. My first experience with this headphone amp was an immediate fail. Stereo cut in an out on two of the channels, and once a second pair of headphones were attached, the sound became distorted and weak. It doesn't amplify at all. I'm returning this one to try a different one that costs more. The whole "too good to be true" thing definitely applies here. Spend your money more wisely than I did
customer_reviews.author: Dallin Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Delightfully tiny, and does exactly what it should
customer_reviews.text: This has been an great little multi-headphone amp for my podcast recording. I've never attempted to do any critical listening with it, but it does exactly what I need and I've never noticed any sound quality issues. It's easy to dial in the right gain for each listener and it's tiny, so it's easy to put somewhere out of the way. It would be incredible to have a battery-powered version of this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Arbit

customer_reviews.title: Why no power switch?  Love it though.
customer_reviews.text: I received this in the mail yesterday. I really love it so far!! I wasn’t getting the volume I needed from my computer alone. It’s great not having to adjust the computers volume now, as well. I sounds much better now!! Really awesome sound with my computer...& my Audio Technica M50x Headphones!! I am HAPPY! “Question: why no power on/off switch? I’m keeping it on all the time. Is this okay to do? I love it so far though! Really boosts the signal! ” (UPDATE: I have it hooked up to a power strip now, & turn it ON/OFF that way.).
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Great 1/4" headphone amp
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my purposes. I am using it to deliver sound to multiple outputs from a small mixer. I am using 1/4" to 3.5mm adapters when necessary and that work ok, but the quality of the adapters is spotty at best it seems like. Probably should have gone withbut if you only need 1/4" connections this works like a charm so I am not going to knock it for doing what it is designed to do. I understood the functionality when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: ThePapa

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 2 reasons: 1) to be able to increase the max volume output on a little sound system I have; and 2) because I use a splitter on that system, I wanted to be able to completely mute volume of different outputs. I am very happy to say this works perfectly!! Also the small frame on it works well to not take up too much space. The only thing that surprised me, was that it uses the 1/4” audio plug instead of the smaller headphone jack on all inputs/outputs. I probably missed it in the product info, but I wasn’t expecting that...so I had to go out and buy a couple adapters.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo P.

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade A/V versatility
customer_reviews.text: This little microamp is perfect for what I needed. I am hard of hearing, and modern A/V receivers only allow for one plug in and mutes the speakers. This allows me to use my headphones as well as all my speakers (for guests) at the time with the ability to ad[just the volume of all of them. I bought another for use downstairs in the man cave!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Tylee

customer_reviews.title: Easy, inexpensive headphone amp solution.
customer_reviews.text: This is what you would expect it to be. A small, easy to use powered headphone amp. It sounds fine for monitoring playback while recording overdubs and the amp provides plenty of power for even large diaphragm cans. The pots were definitely scratchy at first and I had to use cleaner/lube to get the unit working properly after unboxing. Once they and the jacks had been cleaned it works very well. Obviously this isn’t a critical listening tool and I wouldn’t expect it to be at this price range, but it works quite fine for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: HUNTER AND

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for what I wanted to accomplish.
customer_reviews.text: We have a Legrand OnQ digital whole-house audio system in our home. When my musician friends come over to play, or when I'm practicing (drums) and want to play along with the music over the system, it was not possible to get the system loud enough to be able to hear the music over our own playing. I purchased this amplifier to use in conjunction with another device that added a line-level output to my home system, and now we can do both - hear ourselves and hear the music we're playing along with. Perfect for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: J R Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Great Preamp, and Easy to Use and Setup
customer_reviews.text: Superb preamp. I've used this attached to a 4K lCD panel and use it to monitor the sound. The pareamp is easy to setup and the sound quality is excellent. There is sufficient power to drive any headphone and the sound quality is tops. It is also an excellent value. It's important to purchase adapters to attach headphones with the small plug usully supplied with many headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Roger JamesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Sounds awesome - and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly and sounds freakin awesome! Umm... Yeah... Disregard those reviews where it only can be heard on one side of the headphones. You need TRS cables coming out of your source, into the unit, and obviously TRS headphones. (It's the ones where there are 2 black lines on the 1/4" plug) There's no issue with the headphone amp - it's just a matter of lack of understanding on how to properly use this device.
customer_reviews.author: Rockin2TheCore

customer_reviews.title: No power button.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a two person podcast setup in our studio. So far (~a month) it works great. I’m rating it a 3 because it doesn’t even have a simple POWER switch. It just stays on all the time unless I unplug the power plug and let it dangle behind and fall inside the bookcase. Not something I thought about when ordering but it’s kind of annoying. Not a big deal if you’re plugging into a power strip or a switch controlled plug I guess but wish I had known.
customer_reviews.author: Farrin Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Essential but not Indestructable
customer_reviews.text: I had mine next to my bed but it knocked off the foot high table a couple times.That one foot drop onto carpet broke it inside so now I always Velcro such things in place.I can switch between my headphones or through L/Right PC speakers while in bed .The TV flat panel sound cant remotely compare to either.If I where hard of hearing I would try these for inexpensive help on that.I also use one for running my laptop to a pair of full size headphones,PC Speakers and to a musical amplifier without dealing with reconnecting or adjusting volume every time.A third one connects devices on my gaming desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Merritt Swift

customer_reviews.title: Volume only come out of one side
customer_reviews.text: I can't complain about the build and quality of the sound for the price... But the big issue is that volume is only coming out of the left side. I've tried playing with the wires but can't get volume out of the right side... Kind of a big issue when mixing and recording tracks.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Roland TD-1KV electronic drum
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. I tried many amp and aux cable combo with electronic drum. Unfortunately, every other purchase had something missing when I tried with drum. Some had snare sound too low, some had issue with hi-hat. This purchase along with 1/4 to 1/8' adapter, worked perfect with all pads of electronic drum. It comes with power cord. One in (Aux - 1/4 inch) and 4 out line (1/4 inch)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked for about one year
customer_reviews.text: this worked well for about 9 months, then started to give off some static sounds, as well as the knobs working just intermittently as they should. At 14 months, the unit was continuously causing static and crackling noises. So much that I had to stop using it. I tried to lubricate the knobs with an electronical cleaner which didn't seem to help much. When I bought it reviews of this and other Behringer equipment were pretty good, so I thought I would give Behringer another try after having several not so great pieces of equipment from them. I will be looking at another brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Balinas

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound at lower levels
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine until one day I left it plugged in while cranking the PA. Blew every channel. I gave it 4 stars because it would clip if I put to much load into it. Not even half way it would distort and clip. But the sound was a quality sound at a medium level. My band is a 6 piece with horns and everyone has different ear buds or headphones. Everyone had a good sound. Just not real loud levels. It was worth the $16 I paid for it but at $25 I would try something else that could handle a heavier load for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jungle JimTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Great little headphone amp
customer_reviews.text: Great little headphone amp, but does have crackling line noise sometimes, doesn't do it too often if no one moves the headphone amp with their headphone cords, but still it happens, & also makes line noise sometimes when you turn the dials. Besides that it works for my needs & it was only 25 dollars so that's about what I expected. If I had the option I would have bought a nicer headphone amp but I trust Behringer & you can't beat the price on this. Still minus 1 star for cheap potentiometer or whatever it is that makes it have occasional line noise.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bush

customer_reviews.title: so this has been great for keeping them all wired up and in a ...
customer_reviews.text: I use multiple different pairs of headphones hooked up to my Behringer Xenyx mixer, so this has been great for keeping them all wired up and in a more convenient location. It DOES provide proper stereo audio! You just need stereo TRS cables end to end. If yours is mono, you either got the wrong cable or got a defective unit. I wish this had control knobs on the side since I desk-mounted mine. If you crank volume all the way up you can hear static/noise, but it is not audible at all at lower volumes so just keep a high-level input signal!
customer_reviews.author: EposVox

customer_reviews.title: works great, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: works great. much better than cheaper models, even though this product is fairly inexpensive, it's not "cheap". had a lot of problems with a previous amp. this one has no noise or volume issues. can't believe I struggled for so long with the previous product when a nice replacement was so easy and inexpensive. def recommend this product. I use it for a podcast, including live phone calls, in-studio guests...works great.
customer_reviews.author: What the deuce?!

customer_reviews.title: Good amp for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality amplification. I did find that the 50% mark on the amp dial was about the 100% mark of the line without the pre-amp. So the actual amp is from the half-way up to the max. Dials are very sensitive. But for a cheap basic headphone amp, it does the job and the acoustics of the output are well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: db75oh

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is suposed to do. A great value. Works as well as units costing 4x more.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a line-level booster for the output of my computer. I've always complained that the sound card had weak output. With this amp, I get just enough boost AND now I get buffering to separate the load of my stereo and computer speakers. I've got a good ear, and any distortion from using a speaker-level amplifier is inaudible. I have used it for its intended use as an headphone distribution amplifier with good results. In fact, I bought a second one so that I could keep one in that service.
customer_reviews.author: soundman

customer_reviews.title: Successful Session
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a last minute vocal session that came my way. My studio is not fully appointed yet and I needed something inexpensive and quick. I will be auditioning more headphone amps in the future. Amazon and Behringer to the rescue. Shipping was 2 day Prime. The session went smoothly and 4 people were happy with their headphone mixes. Success! My comments after the session: 1- The unit is brighter than the source. Not horribly so. Different headphones will impact that sensation. 2- The first day, when all four outputs were used there was a low level buzz/hum. The second day when only three outputs were used, there was no noise. I will be investigating that further.
customer_reviews.author: jeffw9

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says it does. I’m running headphones on all ports and they all sound good and the individual volume adjustments work as they should. It supports multiple listeners from a single source. Works great. Get yourself the travel case if you’re moving around at all, keeps it together and safe!
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: i bought the more expensive ha800 - had great LED's all kinds of inputs/outputs and switches - looked great worked terrible. this small cheap unit worked wonderfully for me. sound is "bang on" - cost is great too. simple to use - plug in - trs input - headphone out - that's it. this is the second one i bought - my first was purchased over 9 years ago and still working
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. butcher

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable, will be returning.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I got a defective product but the input connector is not reliable, need to keep on adjusting the 1 /4 pin to get sound output in my earphones. Tried multiple wires with same results, so not a wire or jack issue. Sound quality is also vastly inferior compared to what you hear while connected directly to my sound board. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is great and the volume adjustment is sensitive
customer_reviews.text: We bought this microamp as a way of using two sets of headphones for an apartment TV. It was simple to install and works very well. The sound quality is great and the volume adjustment is sensitive. If you plan to use regular headphones, be sure to also order male to female adapter jacks. The microamp has 6.3 mm jack holes and most headphones use 3.5 mm jacks.You can get the adapters in a set of five for $8 through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this due to my previous experience with Behringer amps and pa systems, but have been incredibly pleased. I use it while recording guitar tracks through various Boss and line 6 devices and also while playing Rocksmith. The biggest pros for this amp are the price, zero added latency, integrity of sound quality and the ease of use. For my purposes I have zero cons so far.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: it works nicely, get good adapters.
customer_reviews.text: This amp doesn't make things louder than my phone. It does amp quiter sources to that level. it is clean and the knobs feel nice, distributes sound to different headsets, etc. I use quieter settings than others. Since all of my stuff uses mini plugs, I had to use 1/8 to1/4 trs adaptors on the input and output. I had some issues with old wires, works perfectly with new ones so its probably not the amp if you have problems with it. Also, it had a 60 hz noise when I tested it next to the refrigerator, but its clean where mounted now. It can run 4 ohm speakers at quiet levels.
customer_reviews.author: v 303

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough to hear over the drums and....high distrton!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this thing to route monitor output out to the drummer in his drum room. However, even though he is the only one in his drum-room, a 10' X 20' room carpeted with shag, and with other deadening materials.... he can't hear the mix over his drums... even when pegged. And when pegged "it goes to 11", it is all distorted. You all need to go back to the drawing board, and quit insisting that everyone be using finger drums, and vst plug-ins for their instrument inputs. Try building a unit to be used with actual guitars w/amps, fender Rhodes keyboards, Saxes, horns, and real drums for a change. How about trying that eh?
customer_reviews.author: bob sherwin

customer_reviews.title: puzzle
customer_reviews.text: I had a tough time at first. The plug was in two pieces, apparently to swith plugs for other countries. Unfortunately A piece fell out of the wrapper, and I didn't notice. so was going to give this a zero review as unusable. But then found the piece, and figured out how to use it. Now it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for monitoring tracks, obviously not for audiophiles
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily for recording sessions with a friend or two. Living in an apartment, I can't make too much noise most of the time. Because of this we use headphones instead of monitor speakers. This gives you a cheap and simple way to split the signal into multiple headsets. It does raise the noise floor a bit, but for live monitoring this isn't very important (and it really isn't enough to notice unless you're trying to boost a really weak signal). That being said, if you are looking for the absolute cleanest signal possible, you really shouldn't be looking at Behringer anything.
customer_reviews.author: Erin JonesTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Defective goods.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this amp not too long ago and was excited when it arrived. Small, portable, and the built quality was near excellent. When I plugged it in to test it, it was only outputting on one side. I thought maybe it was the old cables, so I bought new cables and still the same problem. I sent it back and got it replaced. And the second one... same problems. sending this one back for a refund this time.
customer_reviews.author: Moroni Morales

customer_reviews.title: Great Amp for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great amp if you have a serious set of headphones and need a boost to get the most out of your gear. The item is solid metal construction and when I got it; it only came in aluminum finish the black looks so much better. This is also a great item if you have some additional speakers on your laptop or computer rig and want to get a bit more sound from your gear. If you have any additional questions please ask I would be happy to help you out. If you found this review helpful click on the helpful button below as its great to get feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but they work for my needs. There ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, but they work for my needs. There doesn't seem to be a buffer between channels, so the volume controls are somewhat interactive. Make sure the headphones or buds are the same impedance or the lowest will take down the higher. Don't try to use these with TRRS ear buds -- they won't work.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control: released with bad jacks
customer_reviews.text: This brand new device came with a set of jacks that had the middle ring not working for all 5 jacks. Since I didn't have the time to send it for replacement, I ended up fixing it myself by unmounting, adjusting and remounting the 5 jacks manually. It is clear that the product didn't go through a proper QC before leaving the factory and I'm sure this entire batch of production has the same faulty 1/4 stereo jacks. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: R of Scottsdale

customer_reviews.title: Handy gadget if you like to split your audio signal to multiple sources.
customer_reviews.text: Handy little gadget for powering up multiple speakers or headphones. I bought this because I run my PC audio to two gaming chairs, and several sets of small speakers with LED effects. No obvious loss/degradation or other issues that happen with using multiple y-splitters and it lets me control the volume going out of each channel. My only regret is it doesn't have an on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to get a stereo input cable!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Ah, I finally figured this out! You need to ensure the input cable is a TRS stereo cable, as marked by two black lines on the quarter inch jack. Do this, and all will work! Original review: Misleading title and description. Does not output in stereo, which is why I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Straker H. Carryer

customer_reviews.title: Great little amp but too powerful for low impedance headsets
customer_reviews.text: I bought this amp so I could have multiple speakers/headphones attached to my PC without having to change plugs all the time and risk damaging a port or a plug. It was the perfect size because it fit right behind my PC. It did a great job with my regular speakers. Unfortunately, it overpowered my headset (). Within 30 seconds of plugging in the headset, the sound would get a lot of static and then fade away completely. I ended up returning the amp.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: No audio when 1/4 inch jack fully plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: I produce music from my home studio and I purchased this unit so multiple people can listen at the same time - particularly when recording vocals. Like other reviews, I had to pull the input jack out slightly to get audio. Heard nothing when it was fully plugged in. When I was able to get audio through (after pulling the jack out about 1/4 of an inch), the sound quality was very poor - way worse than the source (Apogee Quartet). Tried multiple cables with the same result. It simply doesn't work for my application.
customer_reviews.author: Psymon

customer_reviews.title: Just got this item and it is working great with a clear signal.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I found a better deal on pyle but their purchase limit was 3 and I needed 4 so I bought this one as well. I now fully understand the name as they are a total pyle of garbage as they give little to no boosting and the connections wiggle, pop and crackle... However, the Behringer will not only allow you to adjust the signal and split it to 4 outputs, it will also boost the volume along with splitting the mono signal input to a both left and right output. Purchasing 3 more of these as we speak.
customer_reviews.author: michael clontz

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect! I needed something so my older kids could ...
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect! I needed something so my older kids could watch TV at night without it keeping me awake upstairs. The TV doesn't have an earphone jack but it does have a pre-amp RCA outlet. This micro-amp connected with a cord also purchased from Amazon. Using 1/4-inch to 3.5 mm adapters I now have four handy headphone outlets that can be used. Volume is controlled at the amp so everyone listens at the level they prefer. To top it off, they all agree the sound is awesome through headphones rather than the speakers. Everybody is happy now.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Berry

customer_reviews.title: Great value and solid build quality
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it does. I wouldn't use this to drive anything over 100 ohms. That said, all 4 channels output well enough for me to have 60-80 ohms headsets all concurrently running at good volumes. Great for comparing different cans. This isn't really a portable amp as it requires a 12v input to power it.
customer_reviews.author: Audionerd

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: I got one and thought it was a defect the sound only plays out of one side of the headphones so i got another one sent and the same thing is wrong with that one. You cant have the input 1/4" plugged in all the way for it to play out both sides of headphone. the cord needs to be like halfways plugged in. You have to plug it in like halfway. And the sound quality is horrible very distorted.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Behringer Headphone Amp
customer_reviews.text: These are difficult to find in your everyday guitar or music shop. Somehow the need for headphone amps with multiple, volume controllable outputs is usually relegated to far more expensive gear. Good on Amazon for its expanse of options -the online advantage is obvious (youbrick and mortar stores need to stock these!). I don't need a high-end system but something that does the job, while not being ridiculously cheap either. No muss, no fuss. It works as described. The one thing that surprised me is just how compact this thing is. The only other consideration is that you'll need to accommodate its power supply and have mini-phone to stereo 1/4 plugs on hand, if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mooseville

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not phenomenally.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do: make audio louder. There is a clear, audible hum in this unit that hurts the audio quality. Not a particularly powerful amp either. Returned the same day it was received to hopefully avoid complications with the manufacturer that other customers have mentioned. Personally, I now feel more comfortable spending more for a higher quality amplifier after experiencing this one at $25.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Only plays out of one side...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the unit I received only transmits in mono on the left side of the speakers/headphones UNLESS you position the input cord in *exactly* the right spot - not plugged in all the way. Obviously I can't use this for mixing or recording, as I'm not getting the full range of signal. What do you expect? The thing is like $30. Oh well, live and learn. Don't buy this if you take your mixing seriously, step up to the next price range.
customer_reviews.author: M B.

customer_reviews.title: As Good as Reviews Say it is!
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and inexpensive! Currently using this for a Podcast where we have up to three people in studio. There is no power switch so either you have this connected to another power source that can be shut off or unplug it. It's simple and compact enough to place on a desk where you may not have much room. Compared to other high end amplifiers this one will do the job if you're just looking for a quality headphone splitter for multiple monitoring.
customer_reviews.author: ChevytheCoolest

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little box. I use it in my recording studio to split the sound source with the artists I work with. It works as advertised without adding any color to the sound of the original source (great when mixing down a track). I could raise or lower individual signals going to the artists as needed. Nice clean sound without any hum or buzzing. This is a perfect accessory at a very great price point. My only complaint is that I wish an on/off switch or button were added. Highly recommended for the budget conscious producer or artist. It is also a great item for practical everyday uses as well (hard of hearing, computer, mp3 player, tv, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: DEF88

customer_reviews.title: Loss of Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Good price. And it works well. However, there's a definite loss of sound quality thru this device. For example, when I listen to music with my Sennheiser 595 headphones, the sound quality thru this device is not as good or crisp as when the headphones are plugged directly into the headphone jack on my Mac Pro. If sound quality is very important, you'll be disappointed with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H

customer_reviews.title: Great little headphone mixer
customer_reviews.text: I use it in my home studio so I can have phones for me, the artist in the booth and someone else listening (if I so please) without disturbing the neighbors. I was the cheaper, temporary alterative to one of those passive studio monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Vince!

customer_reviews.title: A great headphone amp for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I needed an affordable headphone solution and this device is perfect. There might be a little higher noise floor than a more expensive solution, but I don't really notice it if so. It's fine. It "just works" - reliably.
customer_reviews.author: M. CoxTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Great for the $
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice little amp, surprising sound quality, metal construction, volume pots feel fantastic, all jacks feel very solid. Four stars because it's not as loud as I expected it to be. Does great with earbuds but doesn't push my HiFiman headphones as loud as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel, The Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone amp for a low-budge home studio.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little headphone amp for the money. I've recorded with my daughter in my home studio since she was a toddler. She just got married and wants a home studio, so I've set her up with Behringer hardware for her new home (apartment) studio. The Behringer product prices are right, and the quality is great. This allows up to 4 people to listen while recording and works great. I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: gdai

customer_reviews.title: Super clean and sturdy metallic structure
customer_reviews.text: Am running a pair of headphones for a vocalists monitoring and my own for tracking songs. Super nifty. Nice petite metal body.
customer_reviews.author: Taanderson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product. Am using it to multiple devices and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. Am using it to multiple devices and they work perfect in sync with no sound delay. I am putting my tv out as in to this device. And then use my LG Loudr FH6, Bose Companion5 to blast sound together. Each device gets its own stereo in and work very well complementing each other. Very good for parties. Works well especially if you have chromecast connected to your tv and watch video songs with phenominal 1000W RMS sound. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Sa

customer_reviews.title: Chyaaaa...Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: +15 db to my desktop did the trick. If you like to watch videos, listen to music etc. and want to make it a much better experience, this is your jam. Make sure to get the... Hosa CMS-110 3.5 mm TRS to 1/4 inch TRS Stereo Interconnect Cable, 10 feet if you don't have the adapters. Overall, this is the biggest bang for your buck for a sound upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: smooth to operate

customer_reviews.title: Great Device Audio Device!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about using this product with my mini DJ setup and 2 amplified computer speaker systems, but it surpassed my expectations. I was amazed that there was no lag between speaker system one (port 2) and speaker system two (port 3). We even attached another set of speakers to this setup with the same results (no lag). (We used 25 FT 1/4in to 1/8in male cables, to spread out the speakers). Another great feature is you can pre-set the portable speaker(s) volume, and then control the multiple volumes through this device.
customer_reviews.author: joshsritch

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: used this product to build a TV amp system for my father who has very bad hearing - coupled it with steno under the chin headphones and a long cord and he can now watch tv again without blowing the rest of us out of the room. We set the tv volume at a normal level and then use gain control on the mini amp to control volume in his headphones.... works like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like most low end products
customer_reviews.text: Like most low end products, the power supply cord is thin and a little bit on the short side. There is a small amount of distorted bleed between channels, but nothing that matters for monitoring tracking. I'm using this as part of an ad hoc recording setup to record students at our vocal studio to allow engineer/producer/vocalist to all monitor during tracking. You'll need a TRS (stereo) 1/4" cable to provide the signal input to the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone amp
customer_reviews.text: Being hearing impaired, this little amp has brought sound back into my world. It is clear and gives good definition. Definitely recommend this product if you need a headphone amp. Added bonus is 4 people can listen at the same time at different volume levels.
customer_reviews.author: Oldster

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice little amp
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little amp, and it's perfect for my needs. I use this for my personal gaming/media PC with 3.5mm jack adapters so I can easily toggle between my Afterglow headset, PC speakers, and my stereo speakers without making a mess with cable splitters or having to plug/unplug anything when I want to switch between audio outputs. I have seen little audio hubs made for PCs, but they typically only support two outputs (headphone and speakers), whereas this supports four.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A.

customer_reviews.title: Has a knob
customer_reviews.text: My friend is 99 years old in assisted living.She can not handle blue-tooth or anything fancy that requires charging and putting things in right side up. This system works very well and is simple to maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Maine

customer_reviews.title: Works well for multi-host podcast
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for splitting monitor phones to four podcasting co-hosts. One bit of advice: get a balanced TRS male/male cable to connect to your mixer, or you'll only get one ear of sound on the headphones. The package does not include the cable, so you'll have to buy one extra.
customer_reviews.author: N.

customer_reviews.title: Got hum & distortion ?  It's not the amplifier.
customer_reviews.text: We are a couple who use headphones to get good stereo sound from sources such as RCA stereo jacks, TV headphone jacks and Computers. No need to jack up volume for construction, low flying aircraft etc. Individual volume control is a real blessing. We have the unit about 4 years. In the last year we experienced hum & distortion followed by failure of the adapter. I have lots of simple 9-v adapters whose open circuit voltage is 12-V. Plugged it and voila perfect operation! I found that 250-300 ma units work best.
customer_reviews.author: S Timothy L.

customer_reviews.title: Solid 4-channel Amp
customer_reviews.text: This tiny amp handles 4-channels with a single input. Each channel has their own volume, which is extremely handy. The power brick is included and is quite small. I highly recommend this amp for simple audio solutions!
customer_reviews.author: Evan Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cheap headphone amp!
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine for my purposes. The construction and feel of the controls is very good. The pots are not scratchy. It has plenty of power to drive studio headphones. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dan AV Guy

customer_reviews.title: VERY neat product
customer_reviews.text: Small as it gets, effective headphone amplification or individual volume control. Great for studio headphone monitors when multiple musicians/vocalists need to monitor their levels with a variety of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Aeolious

customer_reviews.title: Hmm...
customer_reviews.text: Very capable when not using high-impedance headphones, but trying to use anything at 250ohm or higher is going to experience degradation. There was also some random popping in the audio on anything I plugged into it (from Audio-Technica ATH-R70x to Philips SHP-9500)
customer_reviews.author: Jelly Face

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set up for live practice!
customer_reviews.text: Now our band knows how much we suck at sticking to the tempo (coughcoughdrummerit'syourfaultcoughcough). Maybe one day I can play in front of more than my wife and cats, but I also one time decided that drinking robot juice was a good idea. It was, so I'm conflicted
customer_reviews.author: Jacobim B.

customer_reviews.title: Great value if you accept it for what it is!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the lyric techs at our church so they could monitor a song guide with headphones. The amp is not the most powerful, nor the highest quality or most features. If you need a SIMPLE and inexpensive headphone amp, this thing works great! I also use the Presonus HP4 at home and when recording, which is far better in every category. It's also five times the price :). You get what you pay for, so consider the features you need.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm to give my HDTV a headphone output
customer_reviews.text: My HDTV didn't have a headphone out. I combined this with an optical-to-RCA-stereo converter (also from Amazon) plus an RCA-to-miniplug cable and female-miniplug-to-1/4" adapter, plugged the 1/4" into the "input" and another 1/4"-to-miniplug-female adapter in one of the "outputs". Presto, a place to plug in mini-plug headphones. I needed the amp because the optical-to-RCA converter didn't put out but a very quiet signal to my headphones. This boosted it up so I can listen evem when my wife is banging pots in our open-plan kitchen-LR. Nice little unit,VERY well made as you'd expect from Behringer.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jolin

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye Behringer
customer_reviews.text: Was working okay for less than a year and then starting producing terrible distortion that renders it unusable for any real application. This is the third Behringer product I have purchase with such a bad experience. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic piece of gear for splitting your audio signal
customer_reviews.text: This little audio amp is almost perfect. It's cheap. It does exactly what it needs to. It allows me to separately control multiple sets of speakers and a pair of studio headphones. The only missing feature is an on/off button, but it's a small price to pay for this little gem.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Givental

customer_reviews.title: When it works it’s great not sure if mine is defective have to jiggle the input cord
customer_reviews.text: The 1/4 input from the mixer does not connect correctly and has to be wiggled into a good position and then don’t let it move or you Will lose sound. Everything else is tight and it sounds great when the input connection is in properly. Example my niece plays the drums and I play guitar we record through headphones so we don’t have guitar bleeding through the drum mics. Sucks when the input connection slips out and we lose sound
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Lousy sound quality on two pairs of headphones; amp starts clipping when turned above 40% volume or so, producing crackling and pops that are not subtle--they're impossible to ignore.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and awesome
customer_reviews.text: This little guy has made my life so much better. Each member gets their own volume control over their headphones. Been using it for over a year and its solid. Never a single issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Maximize volume clearly for in ear monitors
customer_reviews.text: Great little product! If you are struggling with low audio or poor audio coming from your mixer to your in ear monitors this little unit will fix all that! A very price point product!
customer_reviews.author: MAP

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome. If you hear any hiss - you might need this product for the specific output:
customer_reviews.author: RazorSight

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone amp at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to serve as a volume control for my computer headphones and speakers; after nearly three years (and getting knocked off my desk a number of times), it's still going strong, and sounds great. Recently I'd been having some troubles with a couple of the connectors, and was pleased to discover that it was relatively easy to disassemble and re-solder. Pros: - Sound quality - Construction (durable, light, controls feel nice, easy to repair) Cons: - None
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing Product
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a unit to amplify sound, this is NOT it. It will accommodate four sets of headphones, but crank up the gain too much and the audio will easily distort.
customer_reviews.author: fillgee2

product_meta.title: Behringer Microamp HA400 Ultra-Compact 4-Channel Stereo Headphone Amplifier,Silver
product_meta.description:
Configuration:Headphone AmpMini to the max! You can use this super-compact stereo headphone amplifier with practically all headphones-four of them at the same time, to be exact! For example, you can let up to 4 different people in your studio listen to the main mix while the recording is being made, and each listener can determine his own volume level using the dedicated output level controls. The HA400 contains 4 high-power stereo amplifiers that maintain the highest sonic quality even at maximum volume levels. Ultra low-noise 4580 operational amplifiers are included for outstanding audio performance-these are the same op amps found in “full-size” audio equipment-plus, a DC 12-Volt adapter is included.

AMAZON.COM
If you're tracking more than one musician at once, or if everyone in a group wants to listen to a playback, you need a monitor distribution system. The compact, flexible HA400 can power up to four pairs of headphones and up to four independent volumes.

A Simple Solution
Grab this super-compact amp during your sessions to power practically any headphones--four of them at the same time, to be exact. This allows four people in your studio to listen to the main mix while recording, and each listener can determine their own volume level using the dedicated output level controls. 

Quality Amplification
The HA400 contains 4 high-power stereo amplifiers that maintain the highest sonic quality even at maximum volume levels. These ultra-low-noise 4580 operational amplifiers are included for outstanding audio performance--the same op amps found in "full-size" audio equipment. 

What's in the Box
Behringer HA400 4-Channel Stereo Headphone Amp, Power Adapter, User's Manual
feature_bullets: Ultra-compact headphone amplifier system for studio and stage applications
Highest audio quality with virtually all types of headphones even at maximum volume

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,051 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
